meanings.sent1: The leaves were crinkling under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the paper crinkling as I wrapped the gift.
meanings.sent3: The crinkling of the candy wrapper caught the attention of the children nearby.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, crinkling like a paper being scrunched up.
meanings.sent5: The crinkling of the fire crackling in the fireplace was soothing.

meanings.definition: To form into small, tight wrinkles
meanings.sent1: She crinkled her nose in confusion as she tried to understand the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The old map had crinkled edges from being folded for so long.
meanings.sent3: The fabric crinkled easily, making it perfect for travel.
meanings.sent4: Time had crinkled the once smooth surface of the painting, adding character.
meanings.sent5: The baker crinkled the edges of the pie crust for a decorative finish.

meanings.definition: A slight, sharp sound or ripple
meanings.sent1: The crinkling of the plastic bag caught my attention in the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the crinkling of the leaves as the wind rustled through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The crinkling of the paper bag made her dog come running, expecting a treat.
meanings.sent4: The crinkling of the waves against the shore was a calming lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The crinkling of the autumn leaves underfoot signaled the arrival of fall.
